- Title: The Secret Garden  (1911) ) | Plot: A taut psychological thriller, The Secret Garden stars AJ Cross as Peter Sebastian, a lone spy who must face a global threat that may wreak havoc upon all Americans. Based on the story The Garden of Forking Paths, The Secret Garden is a classic spy movie with all the trappings of a classic spy novel. Full of intrigue and contrivance, The Secret Garden brings a classic spy hero to life who must face the ultimate challenge- to avert a nuclear war and rely solely on his survival skills to cope with his mission. Peter must act fast to stop the terrorists before they are able to carry out their devious plan. Will Peter win out in the end? Or will the terrorists get the upper hand? Find out in this highly intense original movie that is the standard of all spy movies. And unite for a hero that will live on as the ultimate spy reconnoiter since the advent of James Bond.

1. 'The Skull' (2007) - This movie tells the story of the Babels, a strange breed of four- foot- tall creatures who once coexisted happily with human beings on planet Earth. However, when the humans built a huge tower to taunt God, he became angry and drove the Babels underground, while scattering the humans to the corners of the Earth and giving them different languages to keep them separate. Thousands of years later, three Babels are searching underground for the Babel Stone presented to them by God when they lose the map -- which is soon snapped up by a dog, who presents it to his master, an advertising man named Patrick. The Babels are desperate to recover the map, and they recruit Patrick' son David to help them find it  (and the Babel Stone) before the evil Nemrod can steal the stone and claim its powers.
